meanings.definition: To supercalender: to finish paper or cloth by passing between rollers under pressure
meanings.sent1: The factory worker was supercalendering the paper to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to supercalender the cloth to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could supercalender a sheet of paper to make it disappear!
meanings.sent4: The chef supercalendered the dough, pressing it between rollers like a master sculptor.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands moved swiftly, supercalendering the canvas to perfection.

meanings.definition: A supercalender: a machine for supercalendering paper or cloth
meanings.sent1: The supercalender in the factory made the paper smooth and shiny.
meanings.sent2: We need to repair the supercalender to continue processing the cloth.
meanings.sent3: The supercalender at the fair was so big, it looked like a spaceship!
meanings.sent4: The supercalender hummed softly, turning the rough paper into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The old supercalender in the museum was a marvel of engineering.
